snippet: The Supreme Court decision said federal courts should not automatically suspend postconviction challenges from death row inmates who are mentally incompetent to help their lawyers.
abstract: Supreme Court unanimously rules that federal courts should not automatically suspend postconviction challenges from death row inmates who are mentally incompetent to help their lawyers.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court decision said federal courts should not automatically suspend postconviction challenges from death row inmates who are mentally incompetent to help their lawyers.

headline.seo: Justices Rule Mental Incompetence Does Not Merit Automatic Stays of Death Row Suits
headline.main: Justices Rule on Staying Death Row Challenges
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule On Staying Death Row Challenges
